decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to generate infinite mana using cards like High Tide and Basalt Monolith, then use Teferi, Temporal Archmage's ability to untap all lands and artifacts to continually take extra turns with Time Warp effects. The deck includes multiple ways to tutor for combo pieces, counter opponent's spells, and protect the combo with cards like Force of Will and Cryptic Command. Once the combo is assembled, the player can use Teferi's ultimate ability with The Chain Veil to activate powerful planeswalkers multiple times in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent and securing victory. The deck's goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to dominate the game.

The deck revolves around leveraging The Gitrog Monster's abilities to create a powerful engine that allows for consistent card draw, land recursion, and mana ramping. The deck includes a mix of lands that provide multiple benefits such as sacrificing lands for card draw, fetching lands from the library, and producing additional mana. It also includes key spells like Splendid Reclamation, Life from the Loam, and Crucible of Worlds to ensure a steady stream of lands in play. By continuously looping lands from the graveyard back into play, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of resource advantage and powerful spells like Emrakul, the Promised End and Primeval Titan.

This deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders Akiri and Silas Renn to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy that aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. By including a wide range of versatile removal spells, powerful artifacts, and mana acceleration, the deck can quickly establish a dominant board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas, and Urza's Bauble provide additional card advantage and utility, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares offer efficient answers to opposing threats. Overall, this deck excels at deploying threats quickly, disrupting the opponent's game plan, and maintaining a proactive stance throughout the game.

The deck is focused on utilizing low-cost evasive creatures to consistently deal damage to the opponent, with the ability to manipulate the top of the library to maximize the impact of Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow's ability. It includes a mix of disruptive spells and efficient removal to control the board and protect the creatures, ensuring a steady stream of damage towards the opponent. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain a tempo advantage by utilizing cards that synergize well with Yuriko's ability to deal damage based on the CMC of the top card of the library. This aggressive strategy aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing Najeela, the Blade-Blossom as the commander, the deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and inflicting damage efficiently. The deck includes a variety of low-cost creatures with abilities that enhance their combat effectiveness, along with a selection of versatile removal and disruptive spells to control the battlefield. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive nature, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent, forcing them to react to the relentless onslaught of creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence with the commander Najeela, the Blade-Blossom at the helm. It includes a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and powerful tribal synergies to overwhelm opponents quickly in a 1 vs 1 format. By utilizing creatures with haste, pump effects, and tribal boosts, the deck aims to apply pressure from the early turns and maintain a strong offense throughout the game. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities. Overall, the strategy revolves around deploying threats rapidly, leveraging creature synergies, and utilizing versatile removal to control the battlefield and secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and Thopter tokens to establish board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. By utilizing Sai, Master Thopterist as the commander, the deck is able to generate Thopter tokens consistently, which can be supported by various artifact synergies and card advantage engines. The key strategy is to flood the board with artifacts, utilize powerful artifact-based spells and abilities to control the game, and close out the match by leveraging the synergy between artifacts and Thopter tokens. With a mix of aggressive creatures, powerful artifacts, and disruptive spells, this deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through a combination of overwhelming force and strategic decision-making.

This deck revolves around generating a large number of artifact tokens and utilizing various artifacts to control the board and push for damage. With Sai, Master Thopterist at the helm, the deck focuses on creating Thopter tokens, supported by cards like Signal Pest, Steel Overseer, and Skullclamp to pump them up and draw cards. Cards like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker provide additional threats while also offering removal options. The deck also includes various artifact synergies such as Grand Architect, Arcbound Ravager, and Vedalken Shackles to outvalue opponents. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and aggressive threats, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of artifacts.

This deck focuses on gaining life and using it as a resource to control the board and out-value the opponent. Karlov of the Ghost Council rewards gaining life by becoming a big threat on the battlefield. The deck includes lifelink creatures, spells that gain life, and cards that interact with life totals. It also features removal spells and ways to protect Karlov, ensuring that he can stick around and continue to grow in power. The strategy involves managing life totals carefully, making efficient trades, and eventually overwhelming the opponent with a massive Karlov. The deck aims to be aggressive while also having staying power and resilience in longer games.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lord Windgrace's abilities to control the board and manipulate the graveyard for advantage. It includes a toolbox of removal spells like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Maelstrom Pulse, along with powerful land-based spells such as Scapeshift, Crop Rotation, and Splendid Reclamation. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with spells like Explore, Cultivate, and Rampant Growth, allowing for explosive plays like casting big threats such as Primeval Titan or activating Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. It also includes cards like Life from the Loam and Crucible of Worlds to recur lands and maintain a constant stream of resources. The deck is designed to outvalue opponents by grinding them out with its control elements and overwhelming them with powerful land-based strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to generate a lot of mana using Selvala, Heart of the Wilds and other mana dorks, while also utilizing untap effects and mana doubling enchantments. By ramping up quickly, the deck aims to play big creatures like Eldrazi or Craterhoof Behemoth to win the game in one explosive turn. The deck also includes cards like Birthing Pod and Survival of the Fittest to tutor for key creatures and combo pieces, as well as protection spells like Ranger's Guile and Vines of Vastwood to protect its creatures. Overall, the strategy revolves around ramping up quickly, tutoring for key pieces, and finishing the game with powerful creatures or combos.

The deck revolves around building a board presence quickly with aggressive creatures and utilizing pump spells to deal large amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck includes a variety of efficient creatures with abilities that help them grow larger or provide additional value. The inclusion of cards like Rancor, Berserk, and Become Immense allows the deck to surprise the opponent with unexpected bursts of damage. The deck also includes mana acceleration cards like Llanowar Elves and Utopia Sprawl to help cast larger threats ahead of schedule. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and powerful pump spells to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a heavy emphasis on creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Tajic, Legion's Edge serves as the commander to lead the charge, providing protection and a powerful effect to push damage through. The deck includes a wide range of low-cost creatures with haste or powerful abilities to apply pressure from the start. Burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Boros Charm add reach and removal, while equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Skullclamp provide additional value. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, ensuring the deck can deploy threats and answers efficiently to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck revolves around generating infinite mana and using it to repeatedly activate Teferi, Temporal Archmage's -10 ability to take multiple turns in a row, overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and powerful spells like Time Warp and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. It includes a mix of efficient card draw, countermagic, bounce spells, and ways to untap lands to ensure the combo can be assembled quickly and protected from disruption. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces as fast as possible while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a game-winning sequence of extra turns and powerful spell casts.

This deck revolves around utilizing Teferi, Temporal Archmage's ability to untap artifacts to generate mana and control the game by countering opponent's spells and bouncing their threats. The key strategy is to assemble a combo involving artifacts like Basalt Monolith and The Chain Veil to generate infinite mana, allowing you to take extra turns with cards like Time Warp and Time Spiral. By manipulating the board with cards like Cyclonic Rift and Treachery, and drawing cards with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Mystic Confluence, you aim to overwhelm your opponent with powerful spells and disruptive plays while ultimately winning the game with a game-ending threat like Emrakul, the Promised End.

The deck revolves around fast mana ramp and land recursion to quickly generate a large board presence, overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays. Utilizing cards like Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary and Primeval Titan, the deck aims to accelerate its mana production and constantly put pressure on the opponent. With Titania, Protector of Argoth as the commander, the focus is on generating value from sacrificing lands and creating elemental tokens. The deck also includes interaction and protection spells like Ranger's Guile and Sylvan Safekeeper to ensure its threats stick around. Overall, the strategy of the deck is to establish a dominant board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.
